4_1Ci5Y4TxZwY1SQhvQR7Ttbdyyai4WRV5TU.body: I know some people using Gentoo on servers. The good thing is that because of all Gentoo's flags you can get a really thin and fast system. You have exactly what you need and nothing more. You don't have to compile anything on server, you can do that through network. And Gentoo is a really reliable operating system, contrary to Arch Linux.

1_1PvP6Vjh8q44LhyXTiBZc4APMtyzwyttbL.body:
> Sign our Petition to CEO Susan Wojcicki to give us access to our content, and to reinstate our channel.

It sounds like the only place where you keep your videos is YouTube. You really should have original videos on a hard drive in your home or something similar, a drive you have physical access to. Not only because of possible takedown but also because YouTube may reduce quality of videos quite significantly during upload, even when it keeps original resolution. Good that you decided to distribute your videos to other video sharing sites. As @ulrichard said IPFS as a backup is an awesome idea too. ZeroNet is more for websites than sharing big files, as far as I know.
